p.s: The articelarticle Hope of escape lost in translation, written by Zia Haider Rahman and published in 2016, is about language learning and consequences for the integration of immigrant communities in GBGreat Britain.
Zia starts with the fact, that over Â£100 mmillion was spent for translating and interpreting for British residents, to shock the reader and to get their attention (ll. 1-3).
He also says, that we (ll. 3-4) are the reason why they can't learn englishEnglish.
In the second part he writes about the bad situation of a part of London.
Zia tries to get sympathy from the reader and to get closer to the situation of the immigrants.
Next he tells us about his life and experiences as a Bangladeshi, Zia wants that the reader gets closer and to meet Zia.
He also often mentionmentions his parents (ll. 11-14).
Zia is thankful and loves his parents for their achievmentachievement in England.
At the end of his part he writes about his experience in school and says he was a rarity (l. 16).
It was in the 1970s and the most immigrants got to the city, where the other immigrants are living, so it was rare to see ana Bangladeshi.
Zia got the attention from the reader and uses the chance in the last part to talk about the Awareness-raising programms (l. 18).
He wants that more and more people start help other immigrants in the aspect of language and intergrationintegration.
